TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed ProfileSettings extends System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement

Docs.summary: Configures the ASP.NET event profiles. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The ProfileSettings class provides a way to programmatically access and modify the `profiles` element of the `healthMonitoring` section of a configuration file.
Event profiles determine how events are collected by ASP.NET and raised to providers.
## Examples This example demonstrates how to specify values declaratively for several attributes of the `profiles` section, which can also be accessed as members of the ProfileSettings class.
The following configuration file excerpt shows how to declaratively specify values for several properties of the `profiles` section.
``` <healthMonitoring> <profiles> <add name="Default" minInstances="1" maxLimit="Infinite" minInterval="00:10:00" /> <add name="Critical" minInstances="1" maxLimit="1024" minInterval="00:00:00" /> </profiles> </healthMonitoring> ```

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string name) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the object to create.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. using the specified name for the new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The following table shows the default settings that are used for this constructor.
|Property|Default value| |--------------|-------------------| |<xref:System.Web.Configuration.ProfileSettings.Custom%2A>|An empty string ("").| |<xref:System.Web.Configuration.ProfileSettings.MaxLimit%2A>|<xref:System.Int32.MaxValue>.| |<xref:System.Web.Configuration.ProfileSettings.MinInstances%2A>|1.| |<xref:System.Web.Configuration.ProfileSettings.MinInterval%2A>|<xref:System.TimeSpan.Zero>.|

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the fully qualified type of a custom class that implements the interface.
Docs.value: The fully qualified type of a custom class that implements the interface. The default is an empty string ("").

remarks.format:
## Remarks The type reference is formed as follows (items in brackets are not required): *Namespace*.*Typename*, *Assemblyname*[,] [Version=x,] [Culture=y,] [PublicKeyToken=z]. For example, "ExampleNameSpace.ExampleType, Example.Assembly, Version=%ASSEMBLY_VERSION%, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=%MICROSOFT_PUBLICKEY%"
## Examples The following code example shows how to use the Custom property. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HealthMonitoringSection> class.
[!code-cs[System.Web.Configuration.HealthMonitoringSection#66](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.web.configurati_233_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Configuration.HealthMonitoringSection#66](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.web.configurati_233_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of times events of the same type are raised.
Docs.value: The maximum number of times events of the same type are raised. The default is <xref:System.Int32>.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property must have a value greater than zero. The value can be made infinite by setting it to <xref:System.Int32>. Invalid values may cause an exception to be thrown when the configuration section is saved.
This property specifies the maximum number of times an event of the same type will be raised. For example if the value is `10`, the event will be raised 10 times and ignored thereafter.
## Examples The following code example shows how to use the MaxLimit property. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HealthMonitoringSection> class.
[!code-cs[System.Web.Configuration.HealthMonitoringSection#63](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.web.configurati_177_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Configuration.HealthMonitoringSection#63](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.web.configurati_177_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the minimum number of event occurrences before the event is raised to the provider.
Docs.value: The minimum number of event occurrences before the event is fired to the provider. The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property must have a value greater than zero. The value can be made infinite by setting it to <xref:System.Int32>. Invalid values may cause an exception to be thrown when the configuration section is saved.
This property specifies the minimum number of times an event occurs before an event is raised to the provider. For example, a value of `5` means that ASP.NET will not raise an event to the provider until the fifth instance of the event occurs. If the value is infinite (<xref:System.Int32>), then no event will be raised to the provider.
## Examples The following code example shows how to use the MinInstances property. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HealthMonitoringSection> class.
[!code-cs[System.Web.Configuration.HealthMonitoringSection#64](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.web.configurati_62_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Configuration.HealthMonitoringSection#64](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.web.configurati_62_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the minimum interval between two events of the same type.
Docs.value: A <xref:System.TimeSpan> that specifies the minimum interval between two events of the same type. The default is <xref:System.TimeSpan>.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The value can be made infinite by setting it to <xref:System.Int32.MaxValue>. Invalid values may cause an exception when the configuration section is saved.
If the value is <xref:System.TimeSpan.Zero>, then there is no minimum interval.
## Examples The following code example shows how to use the MinInterval property. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HealthMonitoringSection> class.
[!code-cs[System.Web.Configuration.HealthMonitoringSection#65](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.web.configurati_389_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Configuration.HealthMonitoringSection#65](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.web.configurati_389_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the name of the object.
Docs.value: The name of the object. The default is an empty string("").

remarks.format:
## Remarks A unique name is required. Duplicate names may result in a loss of data when the configuration section is saved.
## Examples The following code example shows how to use the Name property. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HealthMonitoringSection> class.
